duties_responsibilities.duty: Performing all human-assisted reproductive technique (ART) procedures and daily tasks to maintain and operate the embryology laboratory.
Reviewing test/procedure results, monitoring the quality control program, and reporting proficiency testing.
Maintaining equipment, monitoring inventory, and ordering reagents and supplies.
Identifying training needs, evaluating competency of testing personnel, and documenting laboratory incidents.
Consulting and advising REI and urology physicians on ART procedures and collaborating with other medical, nursing, counseling, and administrative staff.
Adhering to federal and Florida regulations of human ART and ASRM standards.

education_certification.credential: BS degree in biological sciences, chemistry, reproductive biology, or animal sciences. MS degree preferred.
Certification by the American Board of Bioanalysis (ABB) or equivalent as a technical supervisor (TS) or embryology laboratory director (ELD).
